class moduslam.frontend_manager.graph.base_vertices.OptimizableVertex(index: int = 0, timestamp: int = 0, value: Any = None)[source]

Bases: Vertex

Base abstract optimizable vertex of the Graph with GTSAM properties and is included in GTSAM factor graph as a variable.

abstract property backend_instance: Pose3 | Rot3 | tuple[float, float, float] | NavState | ConstantBias

External backend instance of the vertex.

abstract property backend_index: int

Unique external backend index of an instance.

Bases: RadialEdge

Parameters:

  • pose – optimizable pose.

  • features – non-optimizable 3D points.

  • measurements – a measurement with the distance to the visual feature.

  • factor – GTSAM factor.

  • noise_model – GTSAM noise model of the factor.

Updates edge`s connections in the graph. Does not update backend factor graph.

  • modified_edge – edge with modified vertices.

update(values: Values) → None[source]

Updates the graph with new values.

Parameters:

values – GTSAM values.

TODO: add update for non-optimizable vertices.

_set_index() → int[source]

Sets unique index for the new edge base on the size of the factor graph. Gtsam factor graph sets index to the factor by exploiting the size of the factor graph. This guarantees the uniqueness of the index. However, the size of the factor graph is not equal to the number of factors in the graph, because the factor graph may contain empty slots (null ptr objects). When the factor is removed, the size of the factor graph does not change. To reduce the size of the factor graph, the resize() method should be called.

Returns:

unique index.

_get_unique_optimizable_vertices() → dict[int, OptimizableVertex][source]

Gets vertices with unique backend indices.

Returns:

dict of indices and vertices.

_add_connection(vertex: BaseVertex, edge: BaseEdge) → None[source]

Adds edge to the connection with the vertex. :param vertex: vertex to which the edge is added. :param edge: edge to be added to the vertex.

_remove_connection(vertex: BaseVertex, edge: BaseEdge) → None[source]

Removes edge from the connection with the vertex.

Parameters:

  • vertex – vertex from which the edge is removed.

  • edge – edge to be removed from the vertex.

Attention

if all edges are removed from connection, the vertex still exists in the connection.

moduslam.frontend_manager.graph.index_generator module

class moduslam.frontend_manager.graph.index_generator.IndexStorage[source]

Bases: object

Storage of unique indices.

If the storage is empty, min_idx = float(+inf) and max_idx = float(-inf)

property num_indices: int

Number of indices in the storage.

property min_idx: int

Minimum index in the storage.

property max_idx: int

Maximum index in the storage.

property indices: set[int]

Indices in the storage.

add(index: int) → None[source]

Adds index to the storage.

Parameters:

index – index to add.

Raises:

ValueError – if index is negative.

remove(index: int) → None[source]

Removes index from the storage.

Parameters:

index – index to remove.

normalize() → None[source]

Normalize indices to start from 0.

_update_min_max(index: int) → None[source]

Updates min and max indices.

Parameters:

index – new index to update min and max indices.

moduslam.frontend_manager.graph.index_generator.generate_index(index_storage: IndexStorage) → int[source]
Generates new index for the given indices with the rule:

new index = max index + 1.

Parameters:

index_storage – storage of indices.

Returns:

new index.

find_closest_optimizable_vertex(vertex_type: type[OptimizableVertex], timestamp: int, margin: int) → OptimizableVertex | None[source]

Finds the closest optimizable vertex with the given timestamp, time margin and type. Start searching from the latest vertex to reduce complexity. Complexity: O(N).

TODO: Implement a more efficient search algorithm.Add tests. :param vertex_type: type of the vertex. :param timestamp: timestamp of the vertex. :param margin: time margin.

Returns:

vertex if found, None otherwise.
